title: Extra! Extra! Superior Court Strikes Down Initiative 747
summary: The Washington Superior Court ruled that Initiative 747, which caps annual property tax increases for state and local agencies, is unconstitutional. This decision could significantly impact local governments, particularly fire districts, as rising costs outpace the 1% annual limit, potentially eroding levy rates.
compressed_content: The Superior Court struck down Initiative 747. Rising costs exceed the 1% annual property tax limit. This decision impacts local governments and fire districts. Forego lid lifts may be reconsidered if the court rules in favor of Initiative 747.
search_text: Firehouse Lawyer Volume 6, Number 6E: Superior Court Strikes Down Initiative 747. Initiative 747 limits annual property tax increases for state and local agencies. Rising costs exceed 1% annually. Forego lid lifts may be reconsidered if the court rules in favor of Initiative 747.
